description:
Tree works in a Conservation Area (CA9)

Works:

G1 - 6 x London Planes - Standard tree work1.

G2 - 7 x Limes - Standard tree work 1, lift crown to height of street light and crown thin secondary branches only by 15% - 25%.

G3 - 3 Cherrys (presents of canca) - Reduce crown to marry up one canopy with previous reduction approx 2 - 3 metres.

G4 - Flowering Cherry - Standard tree work 1.

T1 - Not in a conservation area or preserved London Plane (large).  Standard tree work 1 and crown lift to 10 metres.

T2 - Flowering Cherry (grafted) - Cut back lightly away from building, weight reduction of overhanging growth.

T3 - Tree of Heaven - Crown lift to balance, remove epicomic growth and remove deadwood.

T4 - Winter Flowering Cherry - Remove reverted rootstock growth, light lift and thin.

T5 - Magnolia - Standard tree work 1 - Remove major crossing branches.

T6 - Chestnut - Standard tree work 1.

T7 - Robinia - Standard tree work 1.

T8 - Flowering Cherry - Standard tree work 1.

T9 - Magnolia - Remove crossing branches and prune with secateurs.

T10 - Sycamore - Standard tree work 1.

Glossary of Terms

Standard tree work 1.
Prune to 2 metres away from buildings.
Cut back 1 metre away from street furniture.
Lift crowns to enable vehicle or pedestrian access.
Removal of deadwood.
Aerial inspection if climbing is required.
